snippet: Iraqi lawmakers met under pressure to name a new inclusive government, but broke up after a half-hour and will not reconvene for at least a week.
abstract: Iraqi lawmakers fail to reach deal on new government as violence in country rages on; United Nations report confirms that June 2014 was the deadliest month in Iraq since at least 2008, with 2,417 people killed.

byline.contributor: Suadad al-Salhy and Marwa Salman contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Iraqi employees of The New York Times from Tikrit, Baquba, Ramadi, Hilla and Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Iraqi lawmakers met under pressure to name a new inclusive government, but broke up after a half-hour and will not reconvene for at least a week.

headline.main: As Iraqi Violence Rages, Lawmakers Fail to Reach Deal on New Government
headline.print_headline: As Iraqi Violence Rages, Lawmakers Fail to Reach Deal on New Government

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
